intro: Hieracium porrifolium subsp. sparsiglandulum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems, with leaves that are lance-shaped and often lobed. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, typical of the genus Hieracium. It is native to Europe and is often found in meadows and grassy areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
